description: [Daba Finance] Ventures Platform, one of Africa's most active early-stage venture capital firms, has raised $64 million so far for its second fund, with a final close target of $75 million, according to founding partner Kola Aina.
title: Africa: Africa-Focused Early-Stage Investor Ventures Platform Raises $64m

description: [Crop Trust] Genebanks and global cooperation deliver versatile, climate-resilient solutions for farmers
title: Africa: New Potato Variety Offers a Lifeline to Farmers Battling Blight

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- President William Ruto on Thursday held a telephone conversation with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz, during which the two leaders discussed efforts to end ongoing conflicts across Africa and strengthen Kenya-Germany bilateral cooperation, particularly in labour mobility and skills exchange.
title: Africa: Ruto, German Chancellor Merz Discuss Peace in Africa and Bilateral Labour Pact in Phone Conversation

description: [Vanguard] Global Citizen has announced that its flagship Global Citizen NOW action summit will be held in South Africa for the first time on November 21, at the Sandton Convention Centre in Johannesburg.
title: Africa: Global Citizen Now Summit Heads to Johannesburg to Push Africa's Clean Energy Transition

description: [Spotlight Initiative] Doha, Qatar -- During the Second World Summit for Social Development in Doha, Spotlight Initiative and the Qatar Fund for Development (QFFD) hosted the side event 'Invest in adequate social protection for women and girls to drive meaningful change across all Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)'.
title: Africa: Invest in Women and Girls to Drive Change Across SDGs, Urge Leaders At the Second World Summit for Social Development

description: [This Day] ·FRC integrates Islamic finance services within Nigeria's financial reporting framework
title: Africa: Shettima, Emir Sanusi, Others Urge Africa to Leverage Islamic Finance for Inclusive, Sustainable Development

description: [Daba Finance] Dubai-based fintech group Optasia officially listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange (JSE) on Tuesday, November 4, after a R6.5 billion ($345 million) initial public offering priced at R19 per share, the top of its range. The offering was several times oversubscribed, resulting in Optasia having a market capitalization of R23.5 billion ($1.4 billion).
title: Africa: Optasia Raises $345m in South Africa's Largest Fintech IPO

description: [UN News] Civil society networks and private sector leaders crossed paths in the buzzing corridors of the Qatar National Convention Centre, a reminder that social development is not just debated in meetings rooms - it touches jobs, families and futures.
title: Africa: Doha Social Summit - Businesses, Civil Society Walk Side By Side for Fairer Futures

description: [Daba Finance] Romeo Kumalo, the former Vodacom Group executive and co-founder of LLH Capital Ltd., plans to raise a $200 million private equity fund to invest in artificial intelligence-focused companies across Africa.
title: Africa: Ex-Vodacom Executive to Launch $200m Africa AI Fund After Optasia Exit

description: [UN News] As the Second World Summit for Social Development continued in Doha on Wednesday, governments warned that global progress risks stalling unless social protection, equality and peace are prioritised - and backed with political and financial commitment.
title: Africa: Doha - World Summit's Second Day Highlights Urgency of Investing in People and Peace

description: [Vanguard] A report by the World Bank has said that about 2.6 billion people globally lack access to the Internet and are therefore labelled as living in "digital darkness".
title: Africa: 2.6bn People Live in 'Digital Darkness' Globally - World Bank

description: [Shabelle] Mogadishu, Somalia -- Somalia's presidential envoy for stabilization and civilian protection, MP Omar Hashi, met on Wednesday with El-Hadji Ibrahima Diene, the African Union's special representative and head of AUSSOM, to discuss security and recovery efforts in recently liberated areas.
title: Africa: Somalia's Presidential Envoy Meets AU Special Representative On Stabilization

description: [allAfrica] Africa stands at a pivotal juncture, urged to decarbonise for the planet's sake even as it struggles to power its own growth. With 600 million people still lacking access to electricity, and coal providing cheap, reliable energy, the continent faces a significant paradox: the green transition is critical to global climate goals, but for Africa, it could come at a substantial cost.
title: Africa: A Just Transition is a Talent Transition

description: [Nile Post] The African Union Election Observation Mission (AUEOM) has called for urgent constitutional reforms and a more inclusive political environment in Tanzania following the country's October 29 general elections, which the mission described as constrained by legal and institutional shortcomings.
title: Africa: AU Election Mission Calls On Tanzania to Implement Constitutional Reforms and Promote Inclusive Politics

description: [Horn Diplomat] When most investors look at frontier markets, they do so from a distance - placing small bets through funds managed by others.
title: Africa: Somaliland - How a Port Town in Africa Highlights the Potential of Frontier Markets

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The African Union (AU) Election Observation Mission has concluded that Tanzania's October 2025 General Election failed to comply with AU principles, normative frameworks, and international standards for democratic elections, citing legal, institutional, and procedural shortcomings that undermined the integrity of the process.
title: Africa: AU Declares Tanzania's Election Flawed and Undemocratic

description: [World Bank] Washington -- Today the World Bank approved the Technical Assistance to the Southern African Power Pool (SAPP) project, also known as RETRADE SAPP, to support increasing and expanding the regional electricity market in the SAPP.
title: Africa: World Bank and Southern African Power Pool Partner to Expand Regional Power Trade

description: [Oxfam] In reaction to the publication of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) reports on Sudan and South Sudan, Fati N'Zi-Hassane, Oxfam in Africa Regional Director said:
title: Africa: Oxfam Reaction to IPC Hunger Reports On Sudan and South Sudan

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - November 6, 2025

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa -- Health Minister Dr. Mekdes Daba has called for government-led priorities, workforce motivation, and integrated, innovative solutions to transform surgical care across Africa.
title: Africa: Surgery Central to Universal Health Coverage in Africa, Says Health Minister

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- As donor funding for Africa's flagship health programmes declines, African leaders are pushing for greater self-reliance anchored in domestic resource mobilisation, even as they stress that targeted external support remains critical.
title: Africa: Smart Aid Still Matters As Africa Ramps Up Domestic Health Financing

description: [Capital FM] Cape Town, South Africa -- Secure digital payment and identification systems could be the key to unlocking Africa's next wave of entrepreneurs and traders, according to new survey findings released by Co-Develop ahead of the Global DPI Summit 2025.
title: Africa: Survey Reveals Digital Public Infrastructure Could Unlock Africa's Next Generation of Entrepreneurs

description: [Spotlight Initiative] DOHA, Qatar - During the Second World Summit for Social Development, Spotlight Initiative hosted a Solutions Studio conversation to highlight strategies for addressing gender-based violence and to share best practices for driving collaboration on protecting the rights of women and girls.
title: Africa: From Commitment to Impact - Lessons From Leaders Coordinating Efforts to End Violence Against Women and Girls

description: [UN News] Decades of progress in protecting the planet's carbon dioxide-busting forests are at risk as the climate crisis continues to accelerate, UN forestry experts said on Wednesday.
title: Africa: World's Forests At Serious Risk From Warming Planet, Fires and Pests - Unece

description: [African Arguments] The Zambezi is one of Africa's great rivers. Its basin, covering approximately 1,370,000 km2, is home to approximately 50 million people and spreads across eight countries: Angola, Botswana, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, Tanzania, Zambia, and Zimbabwe. The river cascades over Victoria Falls, Mosi-oa-Tunya, "the smoke that thunders," a name used by the Indigenous Batonga and Lozi people, and one of the natural wonders of the world, while also powering major hydroelectric dams such as Kariba and Cahora
title: Africa: Angola's Overlooked Role in the Zambezi River System

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarship, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: The Big Elephant in Brussels
